Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Streptomonomicin (STM, natural AMPs, lactam; XXJ, UCSB1a; class 2 LASSO, bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Metelev M, Tietz JI, Melby JO, Blair PM, Zhu L, Livnat I, Severinov K, Mitchell DA.2015
Literature.Title: Structure, bioactivity, and resistance mechanism of streptomonomicin, an unusual lasso Peptide from an understudied halophilic actinomycete.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is poorly similar (41.67%) toNP-06.Chemical modification:  there is a unique aamide bond between N-terminus NH of S1 and the sidechain of D9.Activity: active against B. anthracis str. Sterne or deltaLF (MIC 2-4 uM), B. halodurans (MIC 4 uM), B. cereus ATCC 4342 or 13472 (MIC 4-7 uM), Bacillus sp. Al Hakam (MIC 7 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 29 uM), L. monocytogenes (MIC 14 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 29 uM), S. aureus (MIC 57 uM), not M.smegmatis (MIC >128 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >128 ug/ml), P.putida (MIC >128 ug/ml), S.cerevisiae (MIC >128 ug/ml), T.stipitatus (MIC >128 ug/ml), A.niger (MIC > 128 ug/ml), and T.longibrachiatum (MIC > 128 ug/ml).Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
